poem:
The Silent Land  

Still, the land stretches, an open palm,  
Under skies vast as promises unkept—  
Where the earth broods over its own heart,  
Men walk, talking of borders, notes  
Faint on the wind, while in the soil  
Old roots resist the axe—tell  
Of a deeper red, the clay crying green.
